DataElement.preferredName: Amendment Change Summary Document Version Version Number Text ISO21090.ST.SIMPLE.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A document, memo or brief that enumerates the differences between two versions of a study protocol document. OTHER NAME(S): Amendment A character string that identifies a given collection of content of a document at a point in time. EXAMPLE(S): Over time, there may be multiple changes to a document, and the version allows an individual to capture relationships between changes in the instances of a document over time. There can be a new version every time the content changes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Amendment Change Summary Document Version Version Number Text
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.:A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.:The words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.
